In three sentences
Comments
Security is great. I feel safe every time i come here.
There's no Greek life
There are many clubs and organizations you can join. There's never nothing to do here.
Ivy Tech is great for any-type of student. This college caters to anyone.
Well, i would say it's the common area that i like the most. There are two floors. One for watching television and hanging out and the other is for relaxing and taking a short break between classes.
The tuition is awesome. I receive the learning i need plus i don't have to stress about paying too much for school.
I spend my times in the library. I may also play pool in the common area. Sometime you check out a laptop from the library, so it's a great way to combine both activities.
The food is fantastic. The prices are fair. I enjoy eating here.
Well, It's a community college so there's no dorm life although i wish they had one.
The academic are interesting. When i came here i wanted to do them all. I believed that the school caters to all types of majors and career fields.
This school is great for anyone. You'll learn a lot. There are plenty of resources that's here to help you on your path of graduation.
This school is safe. This school is affordable. This school is awesome.
pageTitle: Ivy Tech Community College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {303981=Whether yout witness the Greatest Spectacle in Racing in May at the Speedway, or visit the House That Peyton Built, Indianapolis is your one stop shop for sports, shopping, and dining, with pockets of greenery that let you unwind., 174836=Since I just started attending Ivy Tech for the Fall 2012 semester, I have not really heard of any unusual traditions or anything, yet., 386629=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 49798=there are plenty of locations in the downtown area to go to. since this is a community college, campus is usually dead after 10 o'clock., 264573=It is more challenging than college of the 70's and 80's. College is much more rigorous today then in the 70s and80s. I went to college in the 70s and 80s, and now again in 2013,and as a student today, the computers have made much more work, with quizes, tests, projects, discussions, and doing journals online can sometimes be overwhelming.}
